class.name: Range
class.brief_description: Abstract base class for range-based controls.
class.description: Range is a base class for [Control] nodes that change a floating point [i]value[/i] between a [i]minimum[/i] and a [i]maximum[/i], using [i]step[/i] and [i]page[/i], for example a [ScrollBar].

method.name: get_as_ratio
method.description: Return value mapped to 0 to 1 range.

method.name: get_page
method.description: Return the page size, if page is 0, paging is disabled.

method.name: get_step
method.description: Return the stepping, if step is 0, stepping is disabled.

method.name: set_as_ratio
method.description: Set value mapped to 0 to 1 (unit) range, it will then be converted to the actual value within min and max.

method.name: set_min
method.description: Set minimum value, clamped range value to it if it's less.

method.name: set_page
method.description: Set page size. Page is mainly used for scrollbars or anything that controls text scrolling.

method.name: set_step
method.description: Set step value. If step is 0, stepping will be disabled.

method.name: share
method.description: Binds two Ranges together along with any Ranges previously grouped with either of them. When any of Range's member variables change, it will share the new value with all other Ranges in its group.

method.name: unshare
method.description: Stop Range from sharing its member variables with any other Range.

members.member: If [code]true[/code] and [code]min_value[/code] is greater than 0, [code]value[/code] will be represented exponentially rather than linearly.
Maximum value. Range is clamped if [code]value[/code] is greater than [code]max_value[/code]. Default value: 100.
Minimum value. Range is clamped if [code]value[/code] is less than [code]min_value[/code]. Default value: 0.
Page size. Used mainly for [ScrollBar]. ScrollBar's length is its size multiplied by [code]page[/code] over the difference between [code]min_value[/code] and [code]max_value[/code].
If [code]true[/code], [code]value[/code] will always be rounded to the nearest integer.

If greater than 0, [code]value[/code] will always be rounded to a multiple of [code]step[/code]. If [code]rounded[/code] is also [code]true[/code], [code]value[/code] will first be rounded to a multiple of [code]step[/code] then rounded to the nearest integer.

signal.name: changed
signal.description: This signal is emitted when min, max, range or step change.

signal.name: value_changed
signal.description: This signal is emitted when value changes.
